reviews.review_msg: Gurshant is a super nice homie that happens to be a professor. Don't take this class if he is not the professor. He is very funny and he turns boring content fun. His assignments are sooooo relaxing, you can do them a couple of hours before they are do. BYE

Terrible lecturer. Said "um" every 3 words making her very difficult to understand. Also used a lot of words to say very little. Her poor presentation skills made the course content very boring. Criteria for assignments were vague and there was minimal information given about exams.
Terrible lecturer. Unable to explain a concept properly without pausing for mins and saying 'uhh.' Easy course just recommend with a different prof who can actually lecture

If you are considering this as an elective, DON'T!!! Avoid at all cost! Lectures are NOT informative and seems to be all over the place. Hard to understand important points with her lecture style. This course was supposed to be interesting social issues, but it turned out boring.

Lectures were really boring, seems as if she just kept rambling on and on to point where you would forget what she was talking about. Plus, she wasn't that great at explaining some course concepts during lecture. Slides for lectures were okay, but could have been more informative. It was nice having a few options for the paper topics though.

This professor is extremely careless. constant vagueness is difficult to navigate & borderline gaslights.Will throw accusations of plagerism against you, yet when you have extreme amounts of evidence supporting that you did not, will be to prideful to admit wrong. Do not take as you can never appease her unless shes right.
Terrible with communication. Makes you use Chicago citations. Super strict and tough marker. Avoid!
super sweet and kind prof! tests werent too bad if you took notes of your material!

I found Professor Marchbank to be very engaging in lectures and looked forward to class every week! Tutorials were always really fun, the Prof and TAs created an environment that was both informative and laid back. The final exam was a little rough but overall the course content is interesting and if you put in the effort you can get a good mark!

Idk why so many ppl said this course was easy but it wasn't for me at least. There were a lot of readings and final (30%) was hard. The content was interesting but still. The prof and TAs are understanding and accommodating, but it still didn't make the class any less difficult.
I took her online class and it was way too disorganized. Wouldnt recommend

Jennifer was not present in lecturing as her TA's took care of it all (I don't even know what she looks like). There was no organization for the class and way too many assignments back to back that were repeating the same information over and over again. We had to email every single assignment in and did not know where we stood in the class all sem
Unorganized class and very unspecific grading criteria. Tough marker and penalizes for things that were never mentioned previously.
Cannot understand what she is saying, speaks soooo fast, the final was very hard. DO YOUR READINGS

Worst course I've ever taken in my 3 years at SFU. I don't know where the professor is, the TA responds .0001% of the time, and there's absolutely no guidance. I've gotten in touch with some of the other students taking the course and we're all super excited to fail this class! Can't wait for my GPA to drop!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

I don't even know what to say because this professor did not make 1 single appearance. Me and my classmates in this course thought she may have been in a coma or something due to her lack of activity. Seriously this course is a first year level course and me and fellow 2nd, 3rd, 4th years are ripping our hair out crying because we're going to fail!
